para: The &skel; refinement process is ultimately driven by &sgmts; — the refinement rule for each element is determined solely by number and configuration of marked &sgmts; in the element. CheckHeterogeneousEdges directly marks heterogeneous &sgmts; for refinement. Segment homogeneity is defined in .

All &sgmts; whose homogeneity is less than the given threshold will be refined, as long as they're in the set described by the choose_from parameter. (choose_from is a object that can restrict the scope of the refinement. Leave it set to for unrestricted operation.)
shows &sgmts; that have been marked for refinement with threshold=0.9 and choose_from=(), and the result of refining those segments (with divider= and rules==Quick).

caption.para:
In the &skel; on the left, inhomogeneous &sgmts; are highlighted in green. The &skel; on the right is the result of refining these &sgmts; with the command
OOF.Skeleton.Modify( skeleton='swoops.png:skeleton', modifier=Refine( targets=CheckHeterogeneousSegments(threshold=0.9,choose_from=FromAllSegments()), divider=Bisection(minlength=2), rules='Quick', alpha=0.3))
